ovdesc.p: This holds basic information about the external data structure. The information includes - key defns., key position, record types, record key defns, and whether the record is of fixed length format or of variable length format, if variable length records, then the end of record identifier etc.

desc.p: Position in the external record where the starting position of the current record is specified. Input to this field is allowed only if the record length is variable (Field 10 is set to 'V' i.e. variable).
Note: Currently only value allowed is '1', i.e. at the start of the BLOCK CONTROL WORD.
Up to 4 numeric characters.
Starting position of the record key, in the external record.
While transferring the data from external device to T24 data base, in PRIME - INFO format, the record key is generated using the specified ID POSITION, and the ID LENGTH (Field 5).
1 to 4 numeric characters. Mandatory input.
Description of the file record key.
1 - 35 type 'A' (alphanumeric) characters.
Possible record type values, in the position as mentioned in RECORD ID POSITION (Field 7).
Example: In EXBOND external data the record id values are 01, 02, 03 etc. which identifies the record type.
Up to 12 (Type A) alphanumeric characters. Mandatory input.
Position of the record type id in the external record.
This field with RECORD ID LENGTH (Field 8) is used to identify the record type for T24 database update.
1 to 4 numeric characters. Mandatory input.
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.
1 to 35 characters as defined in LOCAL table definition for this local reference field. Multivalued field. Optional or Mandatory input according to definition in LOCAL table.
Description of the record, whose parameters are set in field 13 and 14. This field is associated with RECORD ID VALUE (Field 13).
1 to 35 (Type A) alphanumeric characters. Mandatory input.
Fields REC.ID.VALUE to LL.REC.DESC form a related multi value set.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
Specifies that the external data records are of variable or fixed length
Only allowed values are: 'F' for fixed record length; or 'V' for variable record length Optional input. Default value = F(ixed).
This describes the type of record that are present in the external data record.
Example: In AIBD external data, types of record are = Header, Detail and Trailer record.
In EXBOND external data base, record types are identified as type 01 - detailed entry, 03, 04, 05 etc. as supplementary records to update BONDS data base in T24 system.
1 to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Mandatory input.
External database name i.e. the name of the external data file name which is to be accessed into the T24 system.
Source name - 1 to 10 type AA (alphanumeric) characters. e.g. EXBOND
Length of the record for the type specified in RECORD ID VALUE (Field 13.1). This field is associated with field 13.
Example: In EXBOND external data, record type '01' will have the length 2400 characters, 03 will have the record length 80 characters.
1 to 4 numeric characters. Mandatory input.
Length of the record type id in the external record.
This field with RECORD ID POSITION (Field 7) is used to identify the record type for T24 database update.
1 to 4 numeric characters. Mandatory input.
Position in the external record where the length of the current record is specified. Input to this field is allowed only if the record length is variable (Field 10 is set to 'V' i.e. variable).
Note: Currently the only value allowed is '4', i.e. at the END OF the BLOCK CONTROL WORD.
Up to 4 numeric characters.
Length of the record key, in the external record.
While transferring the data from external device to T24 data base, in PRIME - INFO format, the record key is generated using the specified ID POSITION (Field 4) and the ID LENGTH (Field 5).
1 to 4 numeric characters. Mandatory input.
Specifies whether to update or pick up the T24 data base, using this external data, to/from an unauthorised file or to/from an authorised file.
Only values allowed are: 'A' for authorise file update 'U' for unauthorised file update
Describes the external source data.
1 to 35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. Mandatory input.
Character to identify end of record, in the external record.
Up to 3 (Type A) alphanumeric characters. Optional input.
Name of the external devices from where the data can be loaded.
Note: Currently no checks are made on this field, on actual data transfer operation.
Only allowed values are: 'T' - magtape device 'M' - modem
